column2: IPB Asia serves high net worth individuals and families in Asia as well as small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in India. It offers high-net-worth (HNW) and ultra-high net-worth (UHNW) clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of wealth management. Additionally, in India it offers a comprehensive range of products including investment and insurance products, deposits, checking accounts, cards and other payment services as well as credit and business banking products. Your key responsibilities  Lead the IPB India budgeting, forecasting and long-term planning process with input from key business stakeholders and the Regional head of Performance management. Collaborate with Finance to manage the Local capital RWA monthly and yearly planning process for local capital requirement Own monthly presentation of financials to stakeholders, providing advice, independent challenge and alternative thinking on business strategy. Partnering with Business Finance during weekly and monthly P&L close to provide best estimates and flash to the business on Revenue, Net New Assets, Net New Lending Flows, Balance sheet etc. Review challenge Treasury allocation to IPB India business Review rolling forecasting model to ensure it accurately reflects the operational assumptions of the business. Prepare monthly regional performance management decks Track and monitor actual KPIs and financial performance against budget forecast and provide insight into opportunities and risk Perform ad-hoc analysis where required to assist in management decision making Active lead involvement in new initiatives or projects as required Your Skills and Experience: 5 years of relevant experience in FP&A Proven ability to lead financial planning and forecasting process Prior experience in Wealth Management Private Banking Business Banking beneficial Strong understanding of Financial products Analytical ability using standard and bespoke tools plus a track record of formulating and presenting financial and operational solutions for the business Ability to manage their time and project manage deliverables to deadlines Knowledge and Competencies: Key success factors include strong analytical skills, good communication and presentation skills. Analytical thinking & problem solving Advanced Excel skills in building financial models Strong proficiency using PowerPoint to build charts and MI used in senior management decks. Strong management and coordination skills, ability to manage competing priorities and stakeholders Confident and articulate partner to multiple functions including heads, with the presence to establish credibility Team player who facilitates the sharing of knowledge and the building of teams and who has the ability to work with multi-locational teams across the region
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Business Analysis, project Management, Wealth Management, forecasting, financial planning, performance management

column1: Head of Listed Derivatives Product India
column2: Summary: As part of the Deutsche Bank Investment Bank, the Listed Derivatives product team is a dynamic and versatile global team that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver international and local clients with access to Derivatives listed on Global Exchanges across all asset classes.The Listed Derivatives product team is responsible for defining and delivering the strategy of the business through partnership with Sales, Operations, Technology, Compliance and our various support teams. In addition, the product team supervises the business control framework and is also the lead contact with Exchanges/Clearing house due to their extensive expertise in local regulations.In India, Deutsche Bank provides international clients with access to Custody, FX, Rates and Listed Derivatives as a combined offering. Those clients are often Hedge Funds, Asset Managers, Banks, Brokers and Security Firms.What we'll offer youAs part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that youll enjoy Best in class leave policy Gender neutral parental leaves 100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral) Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents Accident and Term life Insurance Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above Job Description:Responsible for the strategic development of the Listed Derivatives Execution and Clearing offering in India. Proactively manage people decisions to ensure business performance is aligned with organization imperatives and needs, and the business strategy Partner with other Deutsche Bank businesses to deliver a wholistic offering to clients planning to access India Lead the Indian Execution and Post Execution day to day activity:Ensure appropriateness of client reportingEnsure continuous education of our various functional teams to ensure adherence with best practicesOwn the development of value add solutions for clientsBe responsible for the automation of execution and post-execution flows to ensure risk reductionDesign and implement the client communication strategyOptimise the funding of the businessEnsure adherence to the Duty of Legality which include any local legal and regulatory requirements including duties as a business representative towards the local supervisory authorities. Adheres to and promotes the company values and ethical framework, ensuring that the team operates to the same code of conduct. Become an official representative of the entity in which the business operates. Any other duties that may be assigned or communicated from time to time by the Head of Department/local Supervisor. Your Skillset:* An interest in and ability to engage with stakeholders across our clients organisation on both non-investments (COO, Business Manager, Business Development, Operations, Legal, Risk) and Investments (CIO, Portfolio Managers, Traders) functions.* An extensive understanding of the regulatory framework in which a Listed Derivatives framework operates in India and experience in managing a control framework.* A skillset aligned to build and maintain relationships with our target client base, understand their requirements and match that with our Product capabilities.* An interest in and ability to explain the role Listed Derivatives Execution and Clearing offering in India, how it complements DBs FX/Custody offering, and the relevant Indian regulatory framework.* A proven track record to operate in both formal and informal environments and navigate complex organisational relationships to identify and influence stakeholders and decision makers by demonstrating Deutsche Banks Product strengths and client-centric approach.* Expertise in assessing client suitability and to identify AML, reputational and other risks to ensure that proposed Business relationships are in the long-term interest of both the client and Deutsche Bank. Your skills and experience: * Product/Project Management experience in Tier 1 Investment Bank with 5+ years in Listed Derivatives minimum* Candidates with non-Investment Bank experience, but with existing knowledge of the relevant Products gained through related Financial Services employers will be considered.* Candidates should have high energy levels, motivation, and willingness to tackle complicated problems and be held accountable for the outcomes.* Extensive leadership experience* Proven expertise in local relevant regulatory frameworkHow we'll support you: Training and development to help you excel in your career Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Product management, trading, project management, business management, business strategy, investment banking, business analysis, business development, sales, strategic planning, derivatives, trade, key account management, portfolio management

column2: Role Description The Listed Derivatives (Exchange Traded Derivatives) business offers execution and clearing services for firm clients and internal franchise desks who wish to execute and/or clear listed derivatives (futures and options) across global execution venues (exchanges) and CCPs (Clearing Houses). The LD business caters to clients in Europe, US and APAC and is supported by dedicated operational teams across the globe. Listed Derivatives Client Services ensure client Trades/Cash Commissions and Fees are correctly booked on Back-office trade capturing system on trade date. As ETDs are primary tool of hedging portfolios you will play a critical role in managing risk for DB and our clients on day-to-day basis and more so during global events which cause volatility in the financial markets. Your key responsibilities  Manage all communications directly with the clients on all trade related queries in both verbal & written form. Which includes statement generation, daily trade volumes, open position reporting issues, and delivery confirmations/notifications. Provide due diligence on all downstream systems for EMEA/US supported exchanges to ensure proper trade capture; including all pertinent data for DB cleared client business. Research and resolve issues and inquiries regarding exchange facing trades, Liaise with clients, client service, trade support, trading desks, reconciliations teams, and outside firms in a timely manner to efficiently process all Top Day business and resolve any outstanding issues Interact with internal & external contacts for resolution of trade and settlement issues, meeting regular process deadlines and meeting/exceeding client expectations Manage and responsible for running a diverse team by performing various operational tasks and defining an appropriate benchmark and KPIs for each team members and manage adherence. Your skills and experience In-depth knowledge of the Listed Derivatives product across global markets including LME, EUREX, EURONEXT, CME Group, ICE-US & ICE Euro products, including regulations, clearing, expiration, delivery reporting processes & brokerage is a huge positive Knowledge and experience with GMI FIS applications, is a positive Should also be able to investigate process automation & improvements, while being able to document work-flows and procedural changes & amendments as necessary, both from exchange requirements or automation improvements to enhance the Client experience Experience in a client facing role is a must. Must be a fluent  German speaker People management experience will be a positive. Minimum of 8 years of Investment Banking experience.

column2: Trade Finance & Lending is part of Corporate Bank. This will be a P&L holding job from corporates relationship in South India for the TF & Lending.          You will be responsible for managing top tier set of clients across Multinational Corporates and Local Large Corporates including NBFIs. Driving a business revenue of EUR 10M+ from hunting and farming corporate relationships. South India TF&L comprises of PSUs, large LLCs and top MNCs.                What we ll offer you            As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you ll enjoy.            Best in class leave policy.          Gender neutral parental leaves          100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)          Flexible working arrangements          Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education          Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members          Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents          Accident and Term life Insurance          Complimentary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above                  Your key responsibilities:              Leading the set of assigned clients to deliver revenue budget of EUR 25M in South India from all TF&L products.          Work and coordinate with other product teams in the bank in building out a custom solution for clients          Extensive client interaction, interaction with risk, legal, compliance          Managing business risk          Create, maintain, and assist in tracking sectoral trends and related materials.          Maintain excellent relationship with existing and target client names at middle & senior management levels, e.g. Treasurer, Finance Manager, CFO etc.          The candidate will be in-charge of structuring and delivering Deutsche Banks Trade finance & lending solutions clients operating in Mumbai through client meetings, pitches and presentations & responses to requests for proposal. The product areas covered would include Trade Finance, Working Capital solutions, Structured Trade credit, Long tenor loans (including project finance), Trade flow ideas like LC, BG, Supply Chain solutions and Digital Automation.                  Your skills and experience              10+ years of experience in corporate bank, preferably in Trade Finance department of a bank          Understanding of client balance sheet, India regulations          Client Centricity, good communication skills, team management, stakeholder management          Problem solving abilities.          Fast thinking, dynamic and a strong work ethic while being a team player          Educational qualification: MBA or CA / CFA                  How we ll support you              Training and development to help you excel in your career.          Coaching and support from experts in your team          A culture of continuous learning to aid progression.          A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs.

(5) Minimum Diploma / Degree in Business-related major.

column2: About this role:       Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Business Execution Consultant...           In this role, you will:           Lead support functions or operations for multiple business groups and contribute to large scale strategic initiatives     Ensure efficiency, quality, cost effectiveness of solutions, and pipeline management relating to assigned operations     Research moderately complex business, operational, and strategic initiatives that require analytical skills, basic knowledge of organizational strategy and Business Execution, and understanding of international business     Work independently to make recommendations for support function by providing support and leadership     Assist in the planning and execution of a variety of programs and initiatives that may include risk mitigation, efficiency, and customer experience     Collaborate and consult with team leaders in developing project plans, policies and procedures     Provide leadership in management of relationships and implementation of programs, services, and initiatives with cross functional business partners             Required Qualifications,           6+ years of Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education             Required Qualifications,           Experience in    Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning   , or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education         @RWF24

column2: Responsibilities: Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients who invest in fixed income securities. Understand clients' investment objectives, risk tolerance, and financial goals to provide tailored investment solutions. Portfolio Analysis and Recommendations: Analyze clients' existing fixed income portfolios and provide recommendations for optimization and diversification. Identify opportunities for yield enhancement and risk mitigation based on market trends and client preferences. Market Research and Insights: Stay informed about developments in fixed income markets, interest rate movements, and economic indicators. Provide clients with market updates, insights, and investment strategies to help them make informed decisions. New Client Acquisition: Identify and prospect potential clients who could benefit from fixed income investment products and services. Develop and execute strategies to onboard new clients and grow the fixed income client base. Product Education and Training: Educate clients about different types of fixed income securities, their characteristics, and potential risks and rewards. Conduct training sessions and seminars to enhance clients' understanding of fixed income investing. Location: Mumbai/Pune/Delhi NCR/Bangalore/Ahmedabad/Surat
column11: Relationship Management, Client Relationship Management, Market Research

column2: The Job is being created to drive the maintenance and support of Oracle Digital Banking System specializing in Trade Finance to be resilient and available for business 24/7.          ?       About the Role:          Being an Internet banking hybrid channel, supports both web and mobile banking operations for Payments and Cash liquidity solutions for Corporates across the Mashreq bank ie, UAE, IBG and FI locations in future.      This role provides for a critical technical and functional expertise/capability to ensure health and wellness of this GTB production system for High availability of services and consequent revenue growth for the bank.      The role envisages, continuous collaboration with all the stakeholders like Product for Change management, Business for requirements and issue analysis, CSU for customer interactions, feedback and experience, Operations for administration and reconciliation, Development team for implementation of change, Vendors for product upgrades and support and ISG for info security in order to keep the system up and running 24/7.      Provide technical expertise and thought leadership to maintain and support customer facing systems/channels to meet product and organizational objectives to be no 1 Digital Bank. Meet the defined support success criteria.      High availability of systems through effective monitoring and reliability engineering      Service delivery, Optimization and SLA compliance      Process adherence and continuous improvement      Domain Expertise of Corporate Transaction banking; expert knowledge and exposure of Banking applications/platforms; expertise and hands on experience to facilitate technology solution delivery for the bank especially in CIBG function.      Strong technical skills, can cut across multiple groups in a large and complex structured IT setup, specifically act as a bridge between business and technology for high quality delivery of solutions that meet business goals and requirements.      Accountable for the appropriateness of technology solutions delivered to, and the ongoing support and stability of, all applications/modules related to the Corporate Digital Banking platform, including OBDX, H2H, Collections and SCF front end s , mobile banking in collaboration with back end teams      Triaging production bugs, impact & change analysis, and document. Ensure quality fixes.      Co-ordinate with team resources to complete assigned tasks within BAU targets and SLA.      Co-ordinate between business users, technology team members and liaise with vendors for any support, clarifications, or assignments.      Prepare a run plan for DR activities and work with stakeholders to execute DR. Participate and coordinate BCP activities.      Review proposals, SRS for suitability to organization standards functionality, security, architectural and technology fitment.      Review source code quality, test quality and coverage against the deliverables, identify and flag adverse effects of any changes, if any.      Deliver services within agreed timeframe, budget parameters and performance targets.      Execution of maintenance tasks as part of ongoing operational and strategic initiatives.      Ensure the servers are patched time to time and are kept up to date      Ensure User Acceptance Test (UAT) cases are signed off prior to change movement to production. Supervise production transfers ensuring procedural documentation and functional verification is complete.      Participate in audit and other compliance activities as assigned and complete action items for mitigation and rectification.      Assist efforts to improve maintainability, up time and performance of transactional and workflow line of business applications.      Perform call analysis to identify root cause of reoccurring service degradation issues.      Perform incident reporting and engage stakeholders to conclude Root Cause Analysis (RCA), including recommendations and plan for agreed action.      Ensure systems (hardware and software) in all environments meet security baseline standards.      Customer centricity - evaluates client s needs and identifies ways to address key challenges; develops partnerships and generates market leads/demands.      Coordinates internally for timely delivery and helps bank to stay ahead of the curve.      Executive Presence - manage key stakeholders, run business partner review meetings and represent the relevant information on behalf of support/technology, owning and addressing issues and action items arising out of these meetings.      Establish communication channels and Governance with stakeholders in particular with infra, release management, change management, QA, DBA and application teams for timely deliveries rollout.      Vendor Management & Negotiation build, manage and sustain relationships. Establish appropriate operating mechanisms to manage the vendor relationship      Ensure deliveries as per optimized Quality, Service Levels, timelines and cost in line with rollout roadmap.      Influence senior Technology stakeholders to aid the appropriate decisions with regards to system reliability, scalability on the basis of relevant health and engineering metrics.      Provide inputs to yearly budget planning including resources and licenses.      Negotiate with vendors on timelines / quality / cost parameters to secure short- and long-term interests of the bank      Effective use of multiple vendors to ensure productivity through offshoring and outsourcing. Ensure that management is at all times informed of all risks, issues and their status.      Collaborate with Business Product Owners to ensure technology solutions are in sync with system integrity, health and sustenance.      Combine Domain Knowledge and Technical expertise navigating the complexity to evaluate and recommend the most effective solutions. Optimize total cost of operations and retain scalability and stability.      Balance conflicting requirements and needs of team members and project stakeholders for optimal outcome. Use effective judgment to weigh different options for achieving better results within appropriate timeframes      Provide innovative approaches to Business problems by utilizing existing applications / recommending enhancements.      Strategic thinking skills ability to anticipate upcoming trends and changes in the broader environment and apply them to create competitive advantage for Mashreq.      Adhere with the change management process for all production rollouts. Review release note prior to accepting deliverables      Compliance to regulatory, control & audit requirements and manage all known risks, mitigate or accept      Manage crisis in the interim. Escalate and report as appropriate.      Resolve conflicts for resources (hardware, environments, staff and time) based on priorities through out-of-the-box solutions      Investigate defects and conduct Root cause analysis and seek resolution.      Problem and Incident Management. Coordinate on testing and release planning      Participate in Audit, Security and Regulatory compliance knowledge Information Security Operations and Incident Management.      Manage a diversified team of professionals both onshore & offshore, empower and measure their performance and appraise.      Define talent needs. Attract, develop capabilities. Create and implement succession planning for the future, where possible constitute career paths and groom eligible peers.      Collate system performance metrics and work on ways to improve upon constantly.      Adhere to banks operational risk policy, comply and report.      Provide general administrative support to the team, including, meetings, knowledge transfer and Timesheet reporting, weekly status report.          Knowledge, Skills and Experience          Engineer/Post Graduate with 12 Yrs experience in Corporate Banking , of which 4-6 years as Technical Lead on OB products/FCDB/Matrix, H2H or other Corp Channels in support function.      Cross border team management and project experience. Strong organizational, team building and leadership qualities.      Strong business orientation, domain knowledge to comprehend user issues, incidents and problems.      Strong understanding of SDLC processes and support metrics.      Having Extensive hands-on experience in Payments and Liquidity solutions, in particular OBDX, OBP, OBLM, OBVAM, Trade, Collections, Core Banking, General Ledger and Loans      Good verbal and written communication, interpersonal skills including ability to prepare system documentation.      Ability to interpret solution documentation and identify areas of concern and recommend approach.      Ability to multi-task in a dynamic work environment.      Ability to innovate and provide functional applications with intuitive interfaces.      Ability to complete all phases of software development life cycle including analysis, design, functionality, testing and support.
column11: Change management, Team management, Front end, Information security, Incident management, Oracle, Release management, SDLC, Monitoring

column2: The Area Credit Manager - Pre-owned Cars is responsible for managing the credit assessment and approval     processes for pre-owned car financing within a designated geographical area. This role aims to ensure effective     credit risk management, customer evaluation, and loan approval processes, contributing to the growth and     profitability of the organizations pre-owned car financing portfolio.           Principal Accountabilities       1. Assessing and evaluating the creditworthiness of pre-owned car loan applicants based on credit history,     financial statements, and other relevant financial data to determine their eligibility for loan approval.     2. Managing the credit underwriting process, including the analysis of credit risk, loan-to-value ratios, and     repayment capacity, to make informed decisions on loan approvals and credit limits for pre-owned car financing.     3. Collaborating with the sales and marketing teams to identify potential customers, conduct customer     evaluations, and provide guidance on credit terms, loan structures, and financing options for pre-owned car     purchases.     4. Conducting thorough due diligence on loan applications, including verification of customer information,     collateral valuation, and legal documentation, to ensure compliance with internal credit policies and regulatory     requirements.     5. Reviewing and analyzing market trends, industry benchmarks, and customer credit profiles to develop and     refine credit policies, risk assessment frameworks, and loan approval criteria for pre-owned car financing.     6. Managing the portfolio quality of pre-owned car loans, monitoring loan performance, and implementing     strategies for minimizing credit losses and delinquencies within the assigned area of responsibility.     7. Providing guidance and support to the sales and credit teams on credit-related inquiries, customer     negotiations, and loan structuring to facilitate the efficient and effective processing of pre-owned car loan     applications.     8. Ensuring compliance with regulatory guidelines, internal policies, and industry best practices related to credit     assessment, risk management, and loan approval processes for pre-owned car financing.     9. Providing regular reports and updates to senior management on the performance of the pre-owned car     financing portfolio, key credit metrics, and recommended actions to optimize credit risk management and     portfolio profitability within the designated area.     10. Collaborating with internal audit and compliance teams to facilitate audits, inspections, and reviews of credit     processes, ensuring adherence to audit requirements and the implementation of corrective actions as needed.         Desired Profile         Educational Qualification: A bachelors degree in finance, accounting, business administration, or a related field is preferred       A masters degree or relevant certifications in credit analysis or risk management can be advantageous     Experience: 5-7 years of experience in credit management, risk assessment, or lending operations, with a focus on pre-owned car financing, preferably in the financial services industry     Analytical Abilities: Strong analytical skills to assess credit risk, interpret financial data, and make informed decisions on loan approvals and credit limits for pre-owned car financing     Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams, external stakeholders, and customers to facilitate the credit assessment and loan approval processes     Attention to Detail: A keen eye for detail and accuracy in evaluating customer information, financial statements, and collateral documentation to ensure compliance with credit policies and regulatory requirements     Leadership Skills: Strong leadership and team management abilities to effectively lead and mentor a team of credit professionals and drive a culture of excellence and risk management within the area of responsibility
column11: Loans, Manager Internal Audit, Due diligence, Team management, Risk assessment, Credit analysis, Risk management, Principal, Financial services, Monitoring

column2: The ideal candidate should be an accomplished investor with deal execution experience who is interested in helping solve some of the world s most complex problems through investing in companies that deliver positive environmental impact while demonstrating exceptional financial returns to investors.      This is a full-time position with travel required for the effective execution of responsibilities.        KEY RESPONSIBILITIES          Conduct market research on industry trends, sectors, and companies and develop a point of view for the      firm s next private equity fund.      Interact with a variety of stakeholders, and take the lead in identifying and developing new investment      opportunities in thematic areas of interest that are a fit with our values, investor interests, and approach      Lead investment opportunities through various stages of the process, including initial screening, detailed      business diligence - market sizing, technology walkthroughs, competitive landscapes, financial modeling,      reference calls, external DD, presentation to the CC Investment committee, negotiations and closing      Prepare, present, and maintain detailed investment documentation for our clients      Constantly strive to increase the positive impact of our portfolio companies by working with them in an      intensive manner and adding value in critical areas of strategy, operations, business development,      Proactively develop and manage relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders including potential      investees, sector experts, consultants, policymakers, investors, advisors, and thought leaders      Coordinate actively with the India team to understand and track key metrics to monitor the progress being      made by portfolio companies on the goals around social, environmental, and financial returns      Represent Circulate Capital at industry events and build relationships within the startup and investor      Support the global team on specific tasks related to deal screening, due diligence, and execution as and when      Circulate Capital is an investment management firm dedicated to incubating and financing companies that      prevent ocean plastic and advance the circular economy. With c.US$250mn AUM across South Asia, Southeast      Asia and Latin America, the firm focuses on the prevention of mismanaged plastic waste in these regions as well as      investment in disruptive technologies and circular infrastructure.      Our founding investors include PepsiCo, Procter & Gamble, Dow, Danone, CHANEL, Unilever, The Coca-Cola      Company, and Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LLC. To learn more, please visit our website.      https: / / www.circulatecapital.com /      Remotely in India, with travel required for the effective execution of responsibilities. Reports to Associate          KEY COMPETENCIES          5-10 years of overall experience, including at least 3 years of investment experience with venture      Investment experience must comprise making new investments, end to end process management and      MBA from reputed institution and under-graduation in the sciences such as chemistry, biology, engineering,      or related fields OR Chartered Accountant with passion for solving complex environmental issues and      Intuitive understanding of business models and different entrepreneurial styles and an innate ability to strike      strong working relationships with entrepreneurs and a variety of stakeholders that form their ecosystem,      such as other GPs, lenders, sector experts, or policymakers      Proven track record of providing guidance to businesses at multiple levels including operations, strategy, and      governance, through working with a variety of portfolio companies or through working directly in a key role      Outstanding interpersonal skills, with an ability to work well within a multicultural team and effectively      A significant network of peers and related stakeholders in the region      Excellent written and oral communication skills; with an ability to formulate and present analysis and      arguments in a clear, crisp, and concise manner to other team members, Partners, and portfolio companies      Fluency in local language(s) and English      Humility and commitment to producing the highest quality of work, with attention to detail and
